meanings.definition: To become aware of something by seeing or hearing it.
meanings.sent1: I notice the bird singing outside my window.
meanings.sent2: Did you notice the beautiful sunset yesterday?
meanings.sent3: I notice the cat trying to catch its tail, it's quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was so bright, it was hard not to notice her happiness.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise made it impossible not to notice the thunderstorm approaching.

meanings.sent1: The notice on the bulletin board announced the school play.
meanings.sent2: Please read the notice about the upcoming event.
meanings.sent3: The notice about the missing socks made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The notice on the door warned of the upcoming construction.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors on the notice caught everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: A formal declaration of one's intention to end an agreement or contract.
meanings.sent1: He submitted the notice to terminate his lease early.
meanings.sent2: The notice of resignation surprised everyone in the office.
meanings.sent3: The notice to break up with his girlfriend was written in a funny way.
meanings.sent4: Her silence was the notice that their friendship was over.
meanings.sent5: The notice to cancel the event was met with disappointment by many.
